Sure, arrhythmia is a heart condition characterized by an abnormal electrical activity that causes the heart to beat too fast, too slow, or irregularly.
What are the symptoms of arrhythmia?
The symptoms depend on the type of arrhythmia. Common symptoms include palpitations, shortness of breath, chest pain, dizziness, and fainting.
What are the causes of arrhythmia?
The causes of arrhythmia can be many, including heart diseases, high blood pressure, thyroid disorders, stress, and others.
How is arrhythmia diagnosed?
Arrhythmia can be diagnosed through an electrocardiogram (ECG) or a Holter monitor, which records the heart's electrical activity over a period of time.
